question.title: Spring 3.5.x gives 'name' must not be null after upgrading from Spring 3.4.x
question.body:
I got this shortened yaml configuration file:

apiconfiguration:
  apiList:
    -
      queryParameters:
        - something

This is my Java class:


@Getter
@Setter
public class ApiConfig {
    private List<String> queryParameters = Collections.emptyList();
}

After upgrading Spring Boot to 3.5.x (example 3.5.7), I get this error:

Caused by: org.springframework.boot.context.properties.bind.BindException: Failed to bind properties under 'apiconfiguration.api-list[0].query-parameters' to java.util.List<java.lang.String>
    at org.springframework.boot.context.properties.bind.Binder.handleBindError(Binder.java:399)
    at org.springframework.boot.context.properties.ConfigurationPropertiesBinder.bind(ConfigurationPropertiesBinder.java:94)
    at org.springframework.boot.context.properties.ConfigurationPropertiesBindingPostProcessor.bind(ConfigurationPropertiesBindingPostProcessor.java:96)
    ... 60 more
Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: 'name' must not be null

Anybody knows how to fix this issue?

answers.body:
Spring Boot 3.5 introduced internal changes to its Binder.
You can not modify queryParameters because it's an immutable list.
try:

@Getter
@Setter
public class ApiConfig {
    private List<String> queryParameters = new ArrayList<>();
}

question_comments.body: I may be wrong but that yml looks invalid. queryParameters should be next to - not next line?
It doesn't really matter which patch version of Spring is being used, it even fails on Spring 3.5.7
@zawarudo The ticket you linked to is resolved for v3.5.2, but OP stated to be on v3.5.0.
This seems to be a regression in 3.5.x github.com/spring-projects/spring-boot/issues/46032 but it also seems to be resolved
